problem: Let \( f(x) = 3x - 4 \) and \( g(x) = \frac{x}{2} + 1 \). Evaluate \( f(g(f(g(2)))) \).
solution: First, evaluate \( g(2) \): \( g(2) = \frac{2}{2} + 1 = 2 \). Next, evaluate \( f(g(2)) \): \( f(2) = 3(2) - 4 = 2 \). Then, evaluate \( g(f(g(2))) \): \( g(2) = 2 \). Finally, evaluate \( f(g(f(g(2)))) \): \( f(2) = 2 \). Therefore, \( f(g(f(g(2)))) = \boxed{2} \).
